column4: Afternoon again... Nautilus crashes when I log in, and I get a 7914 error - cannot open display - when I try relaunching in terminal... It's not on the forums. Does anyone have any ideas ?
Healot,done.
No go.
does the ~/.xsession-errors give any useful information?
Healot, where is that folder ?
R_Kinder, I've just been given error 7914, Gtk-WARNING **: Cannot open display.
can you create another user account on the box and try logging in with that account?
R_Kinder, unfortunately I'm too much of a newb to manage that :P
could you elaborate please ?
my Nautilus won't load on login.
adding a new user is simple - type: sudo adduser newusername and the prompts will guide you through what to do.
R_Kinder, my thanks, I'll try that :)
R_Kinder, any ideas as to what could be causing the problem ?
not really, but if things work with a different account, then it looks like the account you are currently using could have some corrupted config.
R_Kinder, thanks. I'll bug you one last time :P How could I install KDE and set it as default using the terminal ?
I don't know the answer to that, but my suggestion would be to install 'kubuntu' rather than plain 'ubuntu' - it uses KDE by default.
provided you want KDE rather than Gnome as your desktop of course :)
R_Kinder, I've just been browsing the forums, and apparently Nautilus hasn't just been a bitch to me, and I've used KDE before, so I want to continue if this doesn't work.
what version of Ubuntu are you running?
R_Kinder, running Breezy.
ok - just checking you're on the stable release.
